inclusion.criterion: Refractory hypertension (per JNC-7, this is defined as BP ≥ 140/90 mmHg despite treatment with at least 3 anti-hypertensive drugs, at least one of which is a diuretic, or treatment by ≥ 4 anti-hypertensive drugs)
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Stable anti-hypertensive drug regimen, where no modifications have occurred for at least 2 weeks
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Ability to understand the requirements of the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Willingness to adhere to study restrictions and comply with all post-procedural follow-up requirements
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Subject has a known secondary cause of hypertension
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Subject has isolated White coat hypertension
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Subject has known significant renovascular abnormalities (e.g., significant renal artery stenosis, previous renal artery stenting or angioplasty that precludes the RSDN procedure because of no sites for ablation treatment, or the presence of an accessory renal artery in which the main renal artery is estimated to supply <75% of the kidney)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Subject has hemodynamically significant valvular heart disease for which reduction of blood pressure would be considered hazardous
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Subject has New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class III or IV congestive heart failure, due to either systolic or diastolic dysfunction
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has multifactorial chronic hypoxemia and dyspnea thought due to diastolic CHF, pulmonary hypertension thought secondary to a chronic ASD and COPD on 5L home oxygen. Cardiology consult recommended a right heart cath for evaluation of response to sildenafil but the patient refused.
